title: Bug 10403: Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: When a user creates a new project and points the output folder at a bin directory, which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files, the project creation process does not confirm if the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt.
EB: The project creation process should include a confirmation step to ensure that the bin directory can be deleted and rebuilt successfully.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new project
2. Specify an existing bin directory as the output folder
3. Verify if the project creation process confirms the deletion and successful rebuilding of the bin directory.
